sentence.text: Preclinical studies have demonstrated that positive regulation of cell-matrix adhesion is associated with disease prognosis in a number of human cancers, including glioblastoma.
The four large extracellular domains of positive regulation of cell-matrix adhesion and its association with the extracellular matrix makes it an attractive target for future cancer therapies.
Translational research suggests that positive regulation of cell-matrix adhesion may be targeted with antibodies to improve tumor control and survival in a variety of murine models and cancer types.
